chapter.title: Making a DSP unit
chapter.para: The following sample DSP unit is an extract from the Fragmenter unit. You can see that it is extremely easy to implement a new DSP. All you need is a good editor, the IzSound APIs in a browser and a little bit of C++/STL knowledge.

sect1.title: Playing a pitched sound
sect1.para: In this example, we show how easy it is to play an OGG file with a pitching effect applied to it.

figure.title: Playing a pitched sound - DSP chain

sect1.title: Playing with the connections
sect1.para: In this example, we show how you can connect and disconnect DSP units. It either applies a sound pitching effect or a band filtering effect. Periodicallty, the DSP that is used is disconnected and the other one takes the place in the chain.

figure.title: Playing with the connections - DSP chain
